Gdansk_inf: City on the coast of the Baltic Sea.
Cracow_inf: Royal city.The former capital of Poland.
Gdansk_info: A city with access to the Baltic Sea and a large area of forest. It has beautiful architecture.
Wroclaw_info: A city famous for its dwarf figures, located on the Oder River. The capital of Lower Silesia.
Cracow_info: The city of Polish kings, located on the Vistula River in Malopolska Voivodeship. The former capital of Poland.
Malbork_inf: Malbork, a historic city of the Teutonic Order located in northern Poland on the Nogat River.
Zakopane_inf: Zakopane is located in southern Poland, surrounded by the beautiful mountain massif of the Tatra Mountains.
Warsaw_info: Warsaw is the capital of Poland. The city is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The largest city in Poland.
Poznan_inf: A city in the Wielkopolska Voivodeship. One of the oldest cities to receive city rights.
Katowice_inf: The city is the capital of the Silesian province. The city has access to the Odra and Vistula rivers.
description: Guide to Poland website is dedicated to monuments and interesting places in Poland. We are a team, which deals with booking tickets to places of interest all over Poland. While planning your trip you can make all reservations in one place. If you have any questions, please send us a message.
